The king's heart <FI>is<Fi> in the hand of the LORD, <FI>as<Fi> the rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.<CM>
Every way of a man <FI>is<Fi> right in his own eyes: but the LORD pondereth the hearts.<CM>
To do justice and judgment <FI>is<Fi> more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.<CM>
An high look, and a proud heart, <FI>and<Fi> the plowing of the wicked, <FI>is<Fi> sin.<RF>An…: Heb. Haughtiness of eyes<Rf><RF>the plowing: or, the light<Rf><CM>
The thoughts of the diligent <FI>tend<Fi> only to plenteousness; but of every one <FI>that is<Fi> hasty only to want.<CM>
The getting of treasures by a lying tongue <FI>is<Fi> a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.<CM>
The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.<RF>destroy…: Heb. saw them, or, dwell with them<Rf><CM>
The way of man <FI>is<Fi> froward and strange: but <FI>as for<Fi> the pure, his work <FI>is<Fi> right.<CM>
<FI>It is<Fi> better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.<RF>a brawling…: Heb. a woman of contentions<Rf><RF>a wide…: Heb. an house of society<Rf><CM>
The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.<RF>findeth…: Heb. is not favoured<Rf><CM>
When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.<CM>
The righteous <FI>man<Fi> wisely considereth the house of the wicked: <FI>but God<Fi> overthroweth the wicked for <FI>their<Fi> wickedness.<CM>
Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.<CM>
A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.<CM>
<FI>It is<Fi> joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction <FI>shall be<Fi> to the workers of iniquity.<CM>
The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.<CM>
He that loveth pleasure <FI>shall be<Fi> a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.<RF>pleasure: or, sport<Rf><CM>
The wicked <FI>shall be<Fi> a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.<CM>
<FI>It is<Fi> better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.<RF>in…: Heb. in the land of the desert<Rf><CM>
<FI>There is<Fi> treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.<CM>
He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.<CM>
A wise <FI>man<Fi> scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.<CM>
Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.<CM>
Proud <FI>and<Fi> haughty scorner <FI>is<Fi> his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.<RF>in proud…: Heb. in the wrath of pride<Rf><CM>
The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.
He coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.<CM>
The sacrifice of the wicked <FI>is<Fi> abomination: how much more, <FI>when<Fi> he bringeth it with a wicked mind?<RF>with…: Heb. in wickedness?<Rf><CM>
A false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.<RF>A…: Heb. A witness of lies<Rf><CM>
A wicked man hardeneth his face: but <FI>as for<Fi> the upright, he directeth his way.<RF>directeth: or, considereth<Rf><CM>
<FI>There is<Fi> no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.
The horse <FI>is<Fi> prepared against the day of battle: but safety <FI>is<Fi> of the LORD.<RF>safety: or, victory<Rf><CM>
